# Cambridge International AS & A Level

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 212, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 324, 293]]<|/det|>
## FURTHER MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 368, 317]]<|/det|>
Paper 2 Further Pure Mathematics 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
May/June 2021  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[843, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 393, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 230, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 808, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 485, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 868, 559]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 560, 480, 575]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 575, 880, 606]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 606, 858, 637]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 220, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 730, 714]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75. The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 99, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 332, 88]]<|/det|>
Find \(a\) and \(b\) such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[364, 100, 636, 120]]<|/det|>
\[z^{8} - \mathrm{i}z^{5} - z^{3} + \mathrm{i} = (z^{5} - a)(z^{3} - b). \quad [1]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 256, 146, 275]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 256, 341, 275]]<|/det|>
Hence find the roots of

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[418, 285, 581, 305]]<|/det|>
\[z^{8} - \mathrm{i}z^{5} - z^{3} + \mathrm{i} = 0,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 317, 688, 338]]<|/det|>
giving your answers in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(0\leqslant \theta < 2\pi .\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 319, 920, 338]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 707, 94]]<|/det|>
Find the Maclaurin's series for \(\ln \cosh x\) up to and including the term in \(x^{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 94, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[133, 92, 863, 280]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 294, 920, 330]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \frac{x}{2x^2 - 1}\) for \(x \geqslant 1\), together with a set of \(N - 1\) rectangles of unit width.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 344, 146, 363]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 343, 672, 363]]<|/det|>
By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 363, 626, 403]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{N}\frac{r}{2r^{2} - 1} < \frac{1}{4}\ln (2N^{2} - 1) + 1. \quad [7]\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 373, 920, 392]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 81, 94, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 75, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
By considering the binomial expansions of \(\left(z + \frac{1}{z}\right)^5\) and \(\left(z - \frac{1}{z}\right)^5\), where \(z = \cos \theta + \mathrm{i}\sin \theta\), use de Moivre's theorem to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 123, 636, 153]]<|/det|>
\[\tan^{5}\theta = \frac{\sin 5\theta - a\sin 3\theta + b\sin\theta}{\cos 5\theta + a\cos 3\theta + b\cos\theta},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 159, 465, 179]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 160, 920, 179]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 792, 91]]<|/det|>
Starting from the definitions of \(\sinh\) and \(\cosh\) in terms of exponentials, prove that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 101, 589, 121]]<|/det|>
\[2\sinh^{2}x = \cosh 2x - 1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 920, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 470, 186, 488]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 470, 500, 490]]<|/det|>
Find the solution to the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[406, 496, 591, 524]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} +y\coth x = 4\sinh x\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 534, 401, 553]]<|/det|>
for which \(y = 1\) when \(x = \ln 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 534, 920, 553]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 83, 94, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 78, 693, 106]]<|/det|>
The integral \(I_{n}\), where \(n\) is an integer, is defined by \(I_{n} = \int_{0}^{\frac{3}{2}}(4 + x^{2})^{-\frac{1}{2} n}\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 114, 144, 133]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 114, 715, 134]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(I_{1}\), expressing your answer in logarithmic form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 470, 186, 488]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 465, 603, 492]]<|/det|>
By considering \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{dx}}\Big(x\big(4 + x^{2}\big)^{-\frac{1}{2} n}\Big)\), or otherwise, show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[391, 510, 608, 537]]<|/det|>
\[4nI_{n + 2} = \textstyle \frac{3}{2}\Big(\textstyle \frac{2}{5}\Big)^{n} + (n - 1)I_{n}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 514, 920, 533]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 99, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 574, 89]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) for which the system of equations

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 100, 584, 120]]<|/det|>
\[13x + 18y - 28z = 0,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 120, 584, 139]]<|/det|>
\[-4x - a y + 8z = 0,\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[425, 140, 584, 159]]<|/det|>
\[2x + 6y - 5z = 0,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 166, 410, 185]]<|/det|>
does not have a unique solution.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 168, 920, 185]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 322, 316, 341]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[411, 348, 588, 403]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 13 & 18 & -28 \\ -4 & -1 & 8 \\ 2 & 6 & -5 \end{pmatrix}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 445, 146, 464]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 435, 648, 465]]<|/det|>
Find the eigenvalue of \(\mathbf{A}\) corresponding to the eigenvector \(\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ 0 \\ 1 \end{pmatrix}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 447, 920, 465]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 585, 144, 603]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 584, 653, 603]]<|/det|>
Find a matrix \(\mathbf{P}\) and a diagonal matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(\mathbf{A} = \mathbf{P}\mathbf{D}\mathbf{P}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 586, 920, 604]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[432, 73, 567, 89]]<|/det|>
# Additional Page  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 102, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
If you use the following lined page to complete the answer(s) to any question(s), the question number(s) must be clearly shown.
